column4: I don't have root, so I need it shut down as a regular users.
I don't have root, so I need it shut down as a regular user. Ubuntu can poweroff without sudo, I need to know how it does that
and how I can invoke this from the command line
shutdown: you must be root to do that!
I'll do that noce I'm home.
I have just half-read your problem. You have been hacked?
well, then the auth.log might be of interest. well, what are you trying to do? re-enable sudo?
